entry.title: Outsiders Inspired Batboys: Jason Todd x Chubby! Reader x Tim Drake
entry.summary:
Author: River_Shayde

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,011Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Ever wonder what would happen if Dick had to raise Jason, Tim, and Damian during the 1960s in Gotham? What if they all met a once privileged girl who lost everything and now has to acclimate life in the greaser side of town? How will they all interact and face the villains, socs, and family issues that make up their daily life?Reader turns 18 a few days after meeting the family, and this will mainly be a Jason and Tim love story. I might do two endings depending on how I feel and the direction that the story goes. Protective vibes will be in play.Setting inspired by Grease and the Outsiders.

Summary: ‚ÄúLike a date?‚Äù You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. ‚ÄúYeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.‚Äù Oh. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. ‚ÄúUm, y- yeah.‚Äù You stammer before clearing your throat softly. ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù You say, more confident in your answer. ‚ÄúYes, I would.. love to go with you. entry.title: Baby‚Äôs First Creature-Feature
entry.summary:
Author: TheGoldenPath

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,019Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 43

Summary: She‚Äôs reading to him, a generator manual that looks well read. The pages are yellow and water stained around her long fingers. His vision lazily trails from the book to his bloodied sheets and back to the stranger. Is he hallucinating a comforting presence to make his reality less burdensome? When had his visions ever been pleasant?A pretty girl to sit by his bedside and comfort him in his death. It reminds him of the soft moments of peace in his childhood that he held onto with a white knuckled grip. It reminds him of the few moments his mother felt like a mother. He tries to reach out and touch her hand, just to see if she‚Äôs a fantasy meant to remind him of everything he never fully had only for the pain to jolt up his entire abdomen. That works too. He manages to stifle the pained groan that wants to shoot out from the simple motion. ¬† Lightly inspired by the myth of Circe in the odyssey. (Lightly)

entry.title: The Star that Wouldn't Die
entry.summary:
Author: ShadDork

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 74,779Chapters: 18/29Kudos: 523

Summary: Jason Todd forgot a lot of things after the lazarus pit's putrid green waters helped restore him back to life. Most of it was unimportant information, things that he didn't need to worry about, after all, he could always relearn names, smells, and re-read books. Lost memories weren't as easy to deal with the loss of, but he could always make new ones. The memories that remained were largely traumatic, and the others were slowly being uncovered as time passed.He wished that Dick hadn't said that name, your name. Reigniting feelings and memories. Guilt was already a large part of his existence, and this new guilt about forgetting you entirely was just making everything worse. He shouldn't track you down in case it accidentally put you in danger. But he wanted to make sure that you were okay. It was a battle he lost against himself.As memories he thought were long lost start to return, can he continue to be in your life without dragging you down with him? Can he be in your life without you knowing who he is? He doesn't know, but he wants to try.
